page.title: 03Lower Calbourne Mill
page.content: There is a very interesting{oven}at the mill.It is possibly the only one of its kind still being used.The oven is a stone building lined with bricks.{Faggots}(bundles of sticks from hazel or beech trees) are put into the oven and burnt to heat the oven.The flames heat the top of the oven and the hot ash heats the floor. A rake some 4 metres long is used to rake out the ash and then the bread is put in and the door sealed with dough. The{dough mixing machine}is worked by the{water wheel.}The dough is a slow dough and it is left 8 hours to rise The faggots, which were put in the warm empty oven to dry, are lit and it takes nearly two hours to get the oven hot.The dough is made into loaves.When the oven is ready the bread is put in and takes about one hour to bake.
